name: Zero-Click Law System (ZCL v1.0)
description: A technical framework for Generative Engine Optimization (GEO) and Answer Engine Optimization (AEO) by DrewIs Intelligence.

hasDefinedTerm.name: ZCL-01: CTR Compression Law
hasDefinedTerm.description: The exponential decay of organic click-through rates as AI-generated answers satisfy user intent directly on the SERP.

hasDefinedTerm.name: ZCL-02: Search Displacement Law
hasDefinedTerm.description: The systematic migration of search volume from traditional websites to AI-generated interfaces.

hasDefinedTerm.name: ZCL-03: Efficiency Collapse Law
hasDefinedTerm.description: The reduction in user dwell time on websites as AI synthesis provides immediate answers.

hasDefinedTerm.name: ZCL-04: Revenue Lag Law
hasDefinedTerm.description: The inevitable delay between AI traffic gain and the realization of traditional conversion revenue.

hasDefinedTerm.name: ZCL-05: Authority Entrenchment Law
hasDefinedTerm.description: The prioritization of static, verified authorities (DOIs, Partner IDs) over dynamic web content by generative models.

hasDefinedTerm.name: ZCL-06: Citation Inverse Law
hasDefinedTerm.description: The mathematical relationship where increased AI citations often result in decreased direct website sessions.

hasDefinedTerm.name: ZCL-07: Human-in-the-Loop Paradox
hasDefinedTerm.description: The requirement for human verification in AI outputs despite the increasing automation of search.

hasDefinedTerm.name: ZCL-08: Verification Threshold Law
hasDefinedTerm.description: The point at which AI models exclude unverified sources once a 'Verified Entity' provides equivalent data density.

hasDefinedTerm.name: ZCL-09: Semantic Distance Law
hasDefinedTerm.description: The measurement of how closely a brand's content aligns with the latent space of an AI model's training data.

hasDefinedTerm.name: ZCL-10: Entity Resolution Law
hasDefinedTerm.description: The requirement for clear, machine-readable identity markers to maintain brand presence in a zero-click ecosystem.
